McGavick]], [[CEO]] | num_employees = 4000<ref name="IJ">{{cite news|url=http://www.insurancejournal.com/news/east/2011/12/20/228149.htm|title=XL Hires Another ACE Executive for Its New York Team|date=20 December 2011|work= Insurance Journal }}</ref> | industry = Property & Casualty Insurance | products = | revenue = Selected 2012 Financial Data as at 31 December 2012 Total Assets $45.4 billion<br> Total Shareholders’ Equity $11.9 billion<br> Total Revenues $7.2 billion<br> Attributable to Ordinary Shareholders<br> $651.1 million net income<ref name="IJ2">{{cite news|url=http://www.insurancejournal.com/news/international/2013/02/08/280588.htm|title=XL XL Group Posts $81.4 Million Q4 Net Income; $651.1 Million Full Year|date=8 February 2013|work= Insurance Journal }}</ref> | homepage = [http://www.xlgroup.com http://www.xlgroup.com] | footnotes = [[AM Best]] & [[Standard and Poor's]] rating A }} '''XL Group plc''' ({{NYSE|XL}}) is a global [[insurance]] company headquartered in [[Ireland]] with executive offices in [[Bermuda]] and [[Stamford, Connecticut]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.insurancejournal.com/news/east/2013/05/08/291279.htm|title=XL Group Expands Political Risk Team in New York|date=8 May 2013 |work= Insurance Journal }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.businessinsurance.com/article/20100701/NEWS/100709992 |title=XL Group completes redomestication to Ireland |author=Mark A. Hofmann|date=1 July 2010|work= Business Insurance Magazine }}</ref> The company has approximately 4000 employees and about 60 offices on [[Africa]], [[Asia]], [[Australia]], [[Europe]], [[North America]] and [[South America]]. Formerly XL Capital Ltd, the company officially changed its name and domicile on 1 July 2010.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/xl-capital-to-change-name-place-of-incorporation-2010-04-30|title=XL Capital to change name, place of incorporation|author=Wallace Witkowski |date=30 April 2010|work= [[MarketWatch]] }}</ref> ==Business== XL Group is the global brand used by XL Group plc. The company is organized into two operating segments – [[Insurance]] and [[Reinsurance]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.forbes.com/sites/zacks/2013/05/15/play-the-financials-rebound-with-this-irish-insurance-company/|title=Play The Financials Rebound With This Irish Insurance Company|author=Richard Henry Suttmeier |date=15 May 2013|work= [[Forbes]] }}</ref> Its Insurance segment provides commercial [[Property_insurance|property]], [[Casualty_insurance|casualty]], [[Professional_liability_insurance|professional liability]], [[Pollution_insurance|environmental liability]], aviation and satellite, marine, product recall, political risks, equine, fine art and specie, surplus lines and other coverages. The Reinsurance segment provides casualty, property risk (including energy and engineering), property catastrophe, marine, aviation, and other specialty reinsurance globally.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/finance/stocks/overview?symbol=XL.N|title=XL Group PLC |accessdate=28 April 2013|work= [[Reuters]] }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.propertycasualty360.com/2013/05/17/streamlining-the-claims-process-at-xl-group?t=core-processing|title=Streamlining the Claims Process at XL Group|author=Robert Regis Hyle |date=17 May 2013|work=PropertyCasualty360.com}}</ref><ref name="IJ"/> ==History== The company began as "EXEL Limited".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.propertyandcasualty.com/doc/EXEL-Limited-Announces-Formation-of-XL-Insura-0001|title=EXEL Limited Announces Formation of X.L. Insurance Company of America |date=1 April 1998|work=PropertyandCasualty.com }}</ref> Ian Heap was appointed the company’s first CEO in 1987, followed by Michael Kevany in 1989 serving until 1994. Brian O’Hara became XL’s third CEO in 1994 serving in that position until 2008 when Mike McGavick stepped into the CEO position in May of that year.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.businessinsurance.com/article/20071028/ISSUE01/100023271?tags=76|title=XL to search for new chief as O'Hara retires|author=Douglas Mcleod |date=28 October 2007|work=Business Insurance Magazine}}</ref><ref name="IJ2"/> == References == <references/> == External links == *[http://www.xlgroup.com/ Official website] {{Major insurance companies}} {{finance-company-stub}} [[Category:Companies listed on the New York Stock Exchange]] [[Category:Financial services companies of Bermuda]]
